poem:
Title: "In the Shadow of Banks and Guarded Bills"

Two age-old giants, weary and grizzled,
hold court again beneath D.C.'s thunder. No crisis birthed anew,
yet world wounds still show their rough stitch.
Papers shuffle, yet men's hearts seriously throb.
In the interim of meetings - a breath caught, caught still,
Sorrow's glass half filled, yet, unbroken.
Hope on the edge; slippery, yet stubbornly clung.
